lead_paragraph: Martin Straka has decided to leave the N.H.L. and return to his former Czech club. Straka, who played for the Rangers the last three seasons after joining the N.H.L. in 1992, will be a player and sports director for HC Lasselsberger Plzen, the club said on its Web site Thursday. Straka, a 35-year-old forward, scored 257 goals and had 460 assists in 954 N.H.L. regular-season games, and had 26 goals and 44 assists in the playoffs. He joined the Pittsburgh Penguins in 1992, and also played for the Ottawa Senators, the Islanders, the Florida Panthers and the Los Angeles Kings. He had 14 goals and 27 assists last season.
